workflow.name: Gmail campaign sender: Bulk-send emails and follow up automatically if no reply
workflow.description:
This workflow allows you to send multi-step email campaigns using n8n, Gmail and Google Sheets.

You define a sequence of emails, and a list of email addresses to send them to. The first email is sent to everyone, but the later emails in the sequence are only sent if no-one has replied to the thread yet.

This means you only need to worry about replying to people who respond to your email, not chasing people who don’t.

### Requirements

1. A list of emails in a Google sheet. You can define extra info that will be available to your email templates (e.g. name, company, etc.)

![table.png](fileId:750)

2. A sequence of emails to send, plus how long to wait to send each one, e.g.

- **On day 0:** “Hi, {name} — nice to meet you at the conference. Was wondering whether {company} would be interested in a quick call about X?”
- **On day 3:** “Hi, {name}, just wanted to check in on this. Let me know if there’s any interest!”
- **On day 7:** “{name}, just wanted to give this one last try”

3. A Gmail account (although you could also swap out that part for any other email service)

### How it works

When sending the emails, n8n inserts a hidden attribute in each one that tags it as being part of the email campaign. It then regularly looks through the email threads with that tag and checks whether:

1. No-one has replied yet
2. It’s time to send the next message

The workflow doesn’t send emails on weekends.

### Notes

- This workflow is not intended for spam! Please use responsibly
- You can use this workflow for multiple different campaigns by making copies of the workflow and changing the sequence / Google Sheet that it uses

parameters.jsonOutput:
{ "emails": [ { "message": "Hi {name}, hope you're well!

You're doing some great things at {company}, and I wanted to touch base to see if you wanted to chat.

Would it make sense to jump on a quick call?

Regards,

Nathan
", "send_on_day": 0 }, { "message": "Hi {name},

Just wanted to follow up on this, since it would be great to talk.

Regards,

Nathan
", "send_on_day": 3 }, { "message": "Just thought I'd give this one last try :)

Nathan ", "send_on_day": 8 } ] }

parameters.content:
Follow-up is due if:
- All the messages in the thread are automated (no-one has replied yet)
- Enough time has passed for the next message to be sent

Columns the sheet needs
- email
- first_emailed (leave blank - will be filled in automatically)
- Other columns matching placeholders in email sequence

## Sub-workflow for sending the emails
This is called by the sections above - you shouldn't need to touch it

If reply_message_id is set, will reply to that message.

Otherwise, will send a new message to the user in the 'email' field

# Try me out
1. Clone [this Google worksheet](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/12dsbRpvtVFDdPmyZ7-39vuHuFpM1eMyfOqGGGdsnrtc/edit#gid=0) and update the 'Settings' node with its URL (plus change any other settings there you need to)
2. Adjust the sequence of emails you want to send in the 'Email Sequence' node

Make sure you set how many days after the previous email to wait before sending, and note that the emails are in HTML format.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Execute Workflow node can be used when you want your workflow to treat another workflow as a step in your flow. It allows you to modularize your workflows and have a single source of truth for series of actions you perform often.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.

The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).
